title: Arcade Lissandra Skin Idea
body:
Hello! I've been looking forward to the next Gamescom and the new Arcade skin, so I drew a concept for an Arcade Lissandra skin:
http://i.imgur.com/0nJ3xar.png
Her headpiece would be some kind of stylized virtual reality goggles (sharing visual similarities with Gurren Lagann) and her Ice trail would now be a flowing formation of hue-changing pixels. I also made a gif to have an idea of what it would look like in game:
http://i.imgur.com/NKUyZsP.gif
{{champion:127}}

EDIT:

Here are some sketches and ideas for her Glacial Path (E) skill and Recall!

http://i.imgur.com/UnKxC6X.png
Her glacial path could have "buffs" (don't affect the game, just for viewing pleasure) from vintage games such as pacman ( the cherries), being popped as her claw crosses them. In the end of the skill, there could be a finish flag representing where she would teleport to. Unfortunately I don't have an idea on what her claws could look like.

http://i.imgur.com/NEY92DK.png
Her recall could be inspired by dance dance revolution, having lissandra dance and fail the moves (she doesn't have feet! I guess). In the end of the recall, she could get either disappointed (like heartseeker varus recall) or angry (like arcade miss fortune recall)

Here's some ideas for her animations:
Glacial Claw: Perhaps something like a chain chomp/Pac-Man without infringing on copyright? Or, how about a large digital fist launching out to the location?
Frozen Tomb: I like the idea someone had about an arcade cabinet; Alternatively, how about treasure chests? Those are super iconic in video games. There's good chests, for Lissy ulting herself, and then there's mimics, that have monsters in them that could be the effect used against enemies.
Recall: How about a "beam" up and out? Like, have her fall into the fountain/recall away pixel by pixel, sort of like tetris falling and whatnot. Then, when she's all there, have her come into focus. Alternatively, you could have her come in and out on an elevator platform in the ground, like how Samus comes in when you first launch Metroid for the NES.

Just some thoughts for you.
